sen.j: 下狛駅（しもこまえき）は、京都府相楽郡精華町にある、西日本旅客鉄道（JR西日本）片町線の鉄道駅である。
sen.e: Located in Seikacho, Sorakugun of Kyoto Prefecture, Shimokoma Station is a stop on Katamachi Line, a West Japan Railway Company (JR-West) Line.
Shimokoma Station, located in Seikacho, Sorakugun of Kyoto Prefecture, is a stop on Katamachi Line, a West Japan Railway Company (JR-West) Line.
Shimokoma Station, located in Seika-cho, Sorakugun of Kyoto Prefecture, is a stop on the Katamachi Line of West Japan Railway Company (JR West).
sen.cmt: Seika-choとしました。表現を他の記事と統一

sen.j: 単式1面1線ホームを持つ地上駅。
sen.e: It is an above ground station with a single platform and a single track.
It is an aboveground station with a single platform and a single track.
It is an aboveground station with a single platform and a single track.

sen.j: 棒線構造のため、木津方面行きと京橋方面行きの双方が同一ホームに発着する。
sen.e: From its straight line configuration, trains bound for Kizu and Kyobashi in opposite directions both arrive at and depart from the same platform.
From its straight-line configuration, trains bound for Kizu and Kyobashi in opposite directions both arrive at and depart from the same platform.
From its straight-line configuration, trains bound for Kizu and Kyobashi in opposite directions both arrive at and depart from the same platform.

sen.j: ホーム長は4両分しかないが、2010年3月（2009年度末）をめどに当駅を含めた木津駅～同志社前駅間のホームが7両対応に延伸される予定である。
sen.e: As the length of the platform is just long enough to accommodate only four cars, the platform of this station along with those of all stations between Kizu Station and Doshisha-mae Station are scheduled to be extended to become seven cars compatible by around March 2010 (end fiscal 2009.)

Because the length of the platform is just enough to accommodate four cars, the platform of this station (along with those of all stations between Kizu Station and Doshisha-mae Station) is scheduled to be extended to handle seven cars by around March 2010 (end of fiscal 2009).

Because the length of the platform is just enough to accommodate four cars, the platform of this station (along with those of all stations between Kizu Station and Doshisha-mae Station) is scheduled to be extended to handle seven cars by around March 2010 (end of the fiscal year 2009).
sen.cmt: "fiscal 2009" -> "the fiscal year 2009" に変更しました。

sen.j: 無人駅で駅舎はなく、ホーム南端に屋根が設けられている。
sen.e: It is an unmanned station lacking a station building, but the platform is roofed toward its south end.
It is an unmanned station lacking a station building, but the platform is roofed toward its south end.
It is an unmanned station lacking a station building, but the platform is roofed toward its south end.

sen.j: ホーム中程にも階段があり、出入りができる。
sen.e: Accessible stairs are located in the middle section of the platform.
Accessible stairs are located in the middle section of the platform.
Accessible stairs are located in the middle section of the platform.

sen.j: ICOCA・Jスルー利用可能駅。
sen.e: ICOCA and J Through Cards can be used.
The ICOCA and J Through cards can be used.
The ICOCA and J-Thru cards can be used.

sen.j: JスルーカードやICOCAなどは備え付けの簡易自動改札機で対応する。
sen.e: ICOCA Cards, J Through Cards and others of the like are dealt with by installed automated ticket gates of simplified type.
sen.cmt: Jスルーカードは、もともと簡易改札機では対応できなかった、とJR Westは言っております。
sen.e: ICOCA cards, J Through cards and others of their type are handled by automated ticket gates of simplified type.
ICOCA cards, J-Thru cards and others of their type are handled by automated ticket gates of simplified type.

sen.j: Jスルーカードについては、簡易改札機による対応のため複数枚の処理不可。
sen.e: Simple type automated ticket gates cannot deal with more than one J Through Card being used for a single transaction.
sen.cmt: Jスルーカードは、もともと簡易改札機では対応できなかった、とJR Westは言っております。
sen.e: Simple-type automated ticket gates cannot handle the use of more than one J Through card for a single transaction.
Simple-type automated ticket gates can't handle the use of more than one J-Thru Card for a single transaction.

sen.j: 2006年度の1日あたりの乗車人員は約545人である。
sen.e: Number of passengers getting on at this station was approximately 545 per day in fiscal 2006.
sen.cmt: "約"は"平均"である筈と思われますが。
sen.e: The number of passengers getting on at this station amounted to approximately 545 per day in fiscal 2006.
The number of passengers boarding at this station came to approximately 545 per day in fiscal year 2006.
sen.cmt: 表現を他の記事と統一fiscal→fiscal year

sen.e: (Source: Kyoto Prefecture Statistical Report)

sen.j: 1952年（昭和27年）12月1日 - 日本国有鉄道の駅として開業。
sen.e: Inaugurated as a Japanese National Railways station on Dec. 1, 1952.
It was inaugurated as a Japanese National Railways station on Dec. 1, 1952.
December 1, 1952: The station was inaugurated as a station of Japan National Railways.

sen.j: 1987年（昭和62年）4月1日 - 国鉄分割民営化により、JR西日本の駅となる。
sen.e: Became a JR-West Line station from split privatization of Japan National Railways.
It became a JR-West Line station from split privatization of Japan National Railways.
April 1, 1987: The station became a JR West Line station due to the split privatization of Japan National Railways.
